title: With a dash of banana-flavoring, the antibiotic azithromycin can be a remedy to childhood mortality
author: Michael Lea Senior Writer; Bill; Melinda Gates Foundation
description: The MORDOR study found that twice yearly doses of azithromycin could reduce childhood mortality in sub-Saharan Africa.
cleaned_text: Read next [Looking back on vaccines in 2018](/ideas/articles/vaccines-development-tuberculosis-nigeria) Some of the most significant breakthroughs in 2018 came in the field of vaccine development and delivery, where we again saw progress on immunization. Today, more people in the poorest parts of the world, especially children, are getting protected against infectious diseases, while new innovations are producing vaccines more cheaply and getting them to the communities who need them more effectively. [The danger of complacency: Lost progress in vitamin A distribution](/ideas/articles/lost-progress-in-vitamin-a-distribution) After nearly two decades of rising coverage, our progress on a critical piece in the fight against malnutrition is unravelling. Vitamin A distribution is now at a seven-year low. We know what we need to do to turn the tide—now is the time to do it.
